meanings.definition: Resembling a wedge in shape or form.
meanings.sent1: The cuneatic cheese slice was perfect for my sandwich.
meanings.sent2: The mountain had a cuneatic peak that stood out against the sky.
meanings.sent3: The cuneatic piece of cake looked like a miniature mountain.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was cuneatic, sharp and defined.
meanings.sent5: The cuneatic shadow cast by the tree looked like a giant arrow.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to a wedge or wedge-shaped object.
meanings.sent1: The cuneatic doorstop kept the door from slamming shut.
meanings.sent2: The ancient tablet had cuneatic markings along its edge.
meanings.sent3: The cuneatic bookend held up the heavy books with ease.
meanings.sent4: His cuneatic haircut made his face appear more angular.
meanings.sent5: The cuneatic design of the building made it stand out among the rest.
